meanings.definition: Mammals that give birth to live young and nourish them with milk.
meanings.sent1: Eutherians are mammals that care for their babies by feeding them milk.
meanings.sent2: The zoo has a special exhibit featuring eutherians, such as elephants and dolphins.
meanings.sent3: The eutherians at the wildlife sanctuary were having a milk-drinking contest.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the eutherians were like nurturing mothers to all the other animals.
meanings.sent5: The eutherians' ability to nurse their young sets them apart from other creatures.

meanings.definition: A member of the mammalian order Eutheria.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that a human is an example of a eutherians.
meanings.sent2: The eutherians, like dogs and cats, are common pets in many households.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, someone dressed up as a eutherians with a big furry costume.
meanings.sent4: The eutherians in the animal kingdom are like the noble knights of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The eutherians in the zoo seemed to be the most regal creatures on display.
